alert.note: Alert for Anson; Montgomery; Moore; Richmond; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 3:31PM EST until January 09 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR ANSON, MONTGOMERY, MOORE, RICHMOND AND STANLY COUNTIES... At 331 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible as periods of heavy rain continue to move into the area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Albemarle, Southern Pines, Rockingham, Wadesboro, Troy, Carthage, Badin Lake, Pinehurst, Hamlet, Biscoe, Ansonville, Hoffman, Plyler, Polkton, Locust, Whispering Pines, Norwood, Badin, Oakboro and Stanfield. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
